main event: Initially saw 3 bright red lights in a triangle formation, which expanded to a total of 9 lights during the observation.
interesting points: The sighting occurred over multiple nights from July 10 to July 13, 1962., Residents initially described the sighting as a flying saucer., The lights were part of an advertising aircraft towing a sign with electric lights., The advertising plane was later identified as being operated by A. Wertheimer Co. of Newark., The report involved multiple witnesses and discussions in local news articles.
witness description: Civilian - Mrs. Tessas. Age and occupation unknown.
